page.title: 03Wildlife In Kennethmont 1.
page.content: The rich, fertile gently undulating land is mainly used for pasture or other agricultural purposes although a significant amount is under trees and some of it is bog. The wildlife is rich and varied with numerous species of birds, mammals,insects and plants indigenous to the area.As well as the more numerous species of birds (crows,gulls,sparrows,starlings chaffinches)there are also many pheasants,partridges,dunnocks,wrens, pigeons,collared doves,thrushes, blackbirds,tits,magpies,kestrels swallows,robins,oyster catchers,ducks, lapwings,moorhens,etc.and other species in smaller numbers:owls, curlews,moorhens,herons,etc.There are numerous species of trees but the most common would appear to be Ash, Rowan, Scots Pine, Silver Birch and Gean these are found throughout the area.
